intro: Sedum ternatum, commonly known as the three-leaf stonecrop, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Sedum ternatum is drought-tolerant and is considered a hardy perennial suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
